intro: Tildenia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian tildenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its adaptability in high-altitude climates. Tildenia peruviana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique floral display.
